oai_dc:dc.dc:title: World War I "Fourth Liberty Loan" receipt
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This receipt was given to Confederate veteran David Dotson for his contribution to a World War I bond or liberty loan drive. Dotson was from Grainger County, Tennessee and lost part of a foot at the battle of Franklin, Tennessee on November 30, 1864. The receipt is signed by Carter Glass, Secretary of the Treasury. Dotson served in Co. K, 37th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. Dotson's shoe can be seen as item (davi 108).
